title: 21.2 Linked-list Representation
content:
Section 21.2

Linked-list Representation

Summary

Simple representation using linked lists.

Key Points

  • Each set is a linked list
  • Representative = head of list
  • FIND-SET: follow pointer to head, O(1)
  • UNION: append one list to another
  • Naive UNION: O(n) - must update all pointers

Example

Union by appending smaller list to larger: amortized O(log n) per operation.

Why It Matters

Simple but not optimal - motivates tree-based approach.
